# LOAD LIBRARIES
install.packages("devtools", repos = "http://cran.rstudio.com")

library(tidyverse)

# SPECIFY COLUMNS TYPES
col_types <- list(
  id = col_character(),
  type = col_character(),
  number = col_character(),
  country = col_character(),
  date = col_date("%Y-%m-%d"),
  abstract = col_character(),
  title = col_character(),
  kind = col_character(),
  num_claims = col_double(),
  filename = col_character(),
  withdrawn = col_double()
)

# IMPORT DATA
patent_tbl <- vroom(
  file       = "C:/Users/USER/OneDrive/Pictures/Documents/GitHub/ss23-bdsb-sherlianas/content/data/Patent_data_reduced/patent.tsv", 
  delim      = "\t", 
  col_types  = col_types,
  na         = c("", "NA", "NULL")
)
#> Warning: The following named parsers don't match the column names: type,
#> number, country, abstract, title, kind, filename, withdrawn
patent_assignee_tbl <- vroom(
  file       = "C:/Users/USER/OneDrive/Pictures/Documents/GitHub/ss23-bdsb-sherlianas/content/data/Patent_data_reduced/patent_assignee.tsv", 
  delim      = "\t", 
  col_types  = col_types,
  na         = c("", "NA", "NULL")
)
#> Warning: The following named parsers don't match the column names: id, type,
#> number, country, date, abstract, title, kind, num_claims, filename, withdrawn
assignee_tbl <- vroom(
  file       = "C:/Users/USER/OneDrive/Pictures/Documents/GitHub/ss23-bdsb-sherlianas/content/data/Patent_data_reduced/assignee.tsv", 
  delim      = "\t", 
  col_types  = col_types,
  na         = c("", "NA", "NULL")
)
#> Warning: The following named parsers don't match the column names: number,
#> country, date, abstract, title, kind, num_claims, filename, withdrawn
uspc_tbl <- vroom(
  file       = "C:/Users/USER/OneDrive/Pictures/Documents/GitHub/ss23-bdsb-sherlianas/content/data/Patent_data_reduced/uspc.tsv", 
  delim      = "\t", 
  col_types  = col_types,
  na         = c("", "NA", "NULL")
)
#> Warning: The following named parsers don't match the column names: id, type,
#> number, country, date, abstract, title, kind, num_claims, filename, withdrawn
# CONVERT DATA TO DATA.TABLE
class(assignee_tbl)
#> [1] "spec_tbl_df" "tbl_df"      "tbl"         "data.frame"
setDT(assignee_tbl)
class(patent_assignee_tbl)
#> [1] "spec_tbl_df" "tbl_df"      "tbl"         "data.frame"
setDT(patent_assignee_tbl)
class(patent_tbl)
#> [1] "spec_tbl_df" "tbl_df"      "tbl"         "data.frame"
setDT(patent_tbl)


## Question 1: Patent Dominance 
## What US Corporation has the most patent? List the 10 US corporation with the most assigned patents.

### join data
tic()
Q1_patent_data_combined <- merge(x = patent_assignee_tbl, y = assignee_tbl, 
                       by.x="assignee_id", by.y ="id",
                       all.x = TRUE, 
                       all.y = FALSE)
toc()
#> 0.3 sec elapsed
setkey(Q1_patent_data_combined, "assignee_id")
key(Q1_patent_data_combined)
#> [1] "assignee_id"
Q1_patent_data_combined %>% dim()
#> [1] 315910      4
keep_cols <- c("assignee_id","patent_id","organization")
Q1_patent_data_combined <- Q1_patent_data_combined[, ..keep_cols]
Q1_patent_data_combined %>% dim()
#> [1] 315910      3
Q1_patent_data_combined %>% glimpse()
#> Rows: 315,910
#> Columns: 3
#> $ assignee_id  <chr> "org_004j997jM9yEdS7z4ReD", "org_004j997jM9yEdS7z4ReD", "…
#> $ patent_id    <chr> "8728438", "8921361", "8857791", "8845559", "8815936", "8…
#> $ organization <chr> "University of Basel", "University of Basel", "Zetkama Sp…
tic()
Count_Q1<- Q1_patent_data_combined %>%
  filter(!is.na(organization)) %>%
  count(organization)%>% arrange(desc(n))
toc()
#> 0.5 sec elapsed
head(Count_Q1,10)

1 Answer for Question 1 –> International Business Machines Corporation has the most assigned patent with 7547 patents.

2 Top 10 is listed in the table

## Question 2: Recent Patent Activity ## What US Corporation had the most patents granted in August 2014? List the 10 companies with the new granted patents for August 2014
::: {.cell hash=‘03_data_wrangling_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_71bbde58aa9f4dcf6581208b9da51c3e’}
{.r .cell-code} class(patent_tbl)
::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```{.r .cell-code} setDT(patent_tbl)
tic() Q2_patent_data_combined <- merge(x = patent_tbl, y = Q1_patent_data_combined, by.x=“id”, by.y =“patent_id”, all.x = TRUE, all.y = FALSE) toc() ```
::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```{.r .cell-code} ## Time frame –> 2014-08-01 - 2014-08-31
Q2_Aug2014_patent_data_combined<- with(Q2_patent_data_combined, Q2_patent_data_combined[(date >= “2014-08-01” & date <= “2014-08-31”) ])
tic() Q2_top_Aug2014 <- Q2_Aug2014_patent_data_combined %>% filter(!is.na(organization)) %>% count(organization)%>% arrange(desc(n)) toc() ```
::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
{.r .cell-code} #TOP US company with most patents in Aug 2014 head(Q2_top_Aug2014,1)
::: {.cell-output-display}

{.r .cell-code} ## Answer for Question 2 ## 2.1. TOP US company with most patents in Aug 2014 --> International Business Machines Corporation with 718 granted patents in AUgust 2014 ## Top 10 companies is listed in the table :::

3 Question 3: Innovation in Tech

4 What is the most innovative tech sector? For the top 10 companies worldwide with the most patents, what are the top 5 USPTO tech main classes?

### join data
tic()
Q3_patent_all <- merge(x = uspc_tbl, y = Q1_patent_data_combined, 
                       by.x="patent_id", by.y ="patent_id",
                       all.x = TRUE, 
                       all.y = FALSE)
toc()
#> 5.33 sec elapsed
#Most innovative class can be calculated by summing the total number of patents for each class
tic()
mostinnovative_class_Q3<- Q3_patent_all %>%
  filter(!is.na(mainclass_id)) %>%
  count(mainclass_id)%>% arrange(desc(n))
toc()
#> 0.12 sec elapsed
#making a data frame of TOP 10 companies to investigate the top 5 USPTO
Q3_top10 <- Q3_patent_all[Q3_patent_all$organization %in% c('International Business Machines Corporation','Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd.','Canon Kabushiki Kaisha','Sony Corporation','Microsoft Corporation','Google Inc.','Kabushiki Kaisha Toshiba','QUALCOMM Incorporated','LG Electronics Inc.','Panasonic Corporation'),]

Q3_top10$Company_Class <- paste(Q3_top10$organization, Q3_top10$mainclass_id)

# calculate the company class
tic()
Q3_top10_CC<- Q3_top10 %>%
  count(Company_Class)%>% arrange(desc(n))
toc()
#> 0.02 sec elapsed
#displaying the most innovative class and its corresponding number of patents of that class
head(mostinnovative_class_Q3,1)
#Shows the top 5 USPTO Classes from the top 10 companies granted patents
head(Q3_top10_CC,5)
#Answer for Question 3:
## Most innovative class --> main class id 257 
#TOP 5 USPTO Classes from top 10 companies: listed in the table
